text:
am trying to install Apache 2.4.29 on my AIX 7.1 server.
That was my configure command:
./configure --prefix=/opt/apache --with-included-apr --with-pcre=/opt/pcre --include=/var/tmp/http-2.4.29
/srclib/apr-util/xml/expat/lib
The make ran correctly.

Thought the make install gives me the following error:
...
Target "install" is up to date.
Making install in modules
Making install in aaa
rm -f /opt/apache/modules/mod_authn_file.so
/var/tmp/httpd-2.4.29/srclib/apr/libtool --silent --mode=install install mod_authn_file.la /opt/apache/modules/
find: bad status-- /opt/apache/modules/mod_authn_file.so
install: File mod_authn_file.so was not found.
make: The error code from the last command is 2.


Stop.
make: The error code from the last command is 1.


Stop.
make: The error code from the last command is 1.


Stop.
make: The error code from the last command is 1.


I am not used to compile and I have no idea what to correct so it is installing correctly.

Thanks very much for your help.
creator: cforget@csc.com

text: Bugzilla is for reporting bugs, not for support. Please move over to the users mailing list http://httpd.apache.org/lists.html#http-users for assistance/support/Q&A.
creator: covener@gmail.com
